   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_jump_no_copt_SUITE).
   21: -feature(maybe_expr, enable).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0,suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   24: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   25: 	 undefined_label/1,ambiguous_catch_try_state/1,
   26:          unsafe_move_elimination/1,build_tuple/1,
   27:          coverage/1,call_sharing/1,undecided_allocation/1]).
   28: 
   29: suite() ->
   30:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   31: 
   32: all() ->
   33:     [{group,p}].
   34: 
   35: groups() ->
   36:     [{p,[parallel],
   37:       [undefined_label,
   38:        ambiguous_catch_try_state,
   39:        unsafe_move_elimination,
   40:        build_tuple,
   41:        coverage,
   42:        call_sharing,
   43:        undecided_allocation
   44:       ]}].
   45: 
   46: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   47:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   48:     Config.
   49: 
   50: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   51:     ok.
   52: 
   53: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: undefined_label(_Config) ->
   60:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch flights(0, [], [])),
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: %% Would lose a label when compiled with no_copt.
   64: 
   65: flights(0, [], []) when [], 0; 0.0, [], false ->
   66:     clark;
   67: flights(_, Reproduction, introduction) when false, Reproduction ->
   68:     responsible.
   69: 
   70: %% [ERL-209] beam_jump would share 'catch' blocks, causing an
   71: %% ambiguous_catch_try_state error in beam_validator.
   72: 
   73: ambiguous_catch_try_state(Config) ->
   74:     {{'EXIT',{{case_clause,song},_}},{'EXIT',{{case_clause,song},_}}} =
   75: 	checks(42),
   76: 
   77:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,42},_}} = (catch unsafe_sharing()),
   78: 
   79:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,b},_}} = (catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_1(<<>>)),
   80:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,b},_}} = (catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_1(Config)),
   81: 
   82:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,0},_}} = (catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_2()),
   83:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,0},_}} = (catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_3()),
   84: 
   85:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_4(),
   86: 
   87:     ok.
   88: 
   89: river() -> song.
   90: 
   91: checks(Wanted) ->
   92:     %% Must be one line to cause the unsafe optimization.
   93:     {catch case river() of sheet -> begin +Wanted, if "da" -> Wanted end end end, catch case river() of sheet -> begin + Wanted, if "da" -> Wanted end end end}.
   94: 
   95: %% Must be one line to cause the unsafe optimization. Would cause beam_validator to reject the function.
   96: unsafe_sharing() -> try try id(42) catch parent:215 -> []; education:17 -> try 12 catch _:_ -> a end /= if false -> fy end end of [] -> if false -> a end catch _:_ -> name end.
   97: 
   98: unsafe_move_elimination(_Config) ->
   99:     {{left,right,false},false} = unsafe_move_elimination_1(left, right, false),
  100:     {{false,right,false},false} = unsafe_move_elimination_1(false, right, true),
  101:     {{true,right,right},right} = unsafe_move_elimination_1(true, right, true),
  102:     [ok = unsafe_move_elimination_2(I) || I <- lists:seq(0,16)],
  103:     ok.
  104: 
  105: unsafe_move_elimination_1(Left, Right, Simple0) ->
  106:     id(1),
  107: 
  108:     %% The move at label 29 would be removed by beam_jump, which is unsafe because
  109:     %% the two select_val instructions have different source registers.
  110:     %%
  111:     %%   {select_val,{y,0},{f,25},{list,[{atom,true},{f,27},{atom,false},{f,29}]}}.
  112:     %%               ^^^^^                                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  113:     %% {label,27}.
  114:     %%   {kill,{y,0}}.
  115:     %%   {move,{y,2},{x,0}}.
  116:     %%   {line,...}.
  117:     %%   {call,1,{f,31}}.
  118:     %%   {select_val,{x,0},{f,33},{list,[{atom,true},{f,35},{atom,false},{f,29}]}}.
  119:     %%               ^^^^^                                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  120:     %% {label,29}.
  121:     %%   {move,{atom,false},{y,0}}.  <=== REMOVED (unsafely).
  122:     %%   {jump,{f,37}}.
  123: 
  124:     Simple = case case Simple0 of
  125:                       false -> false;
  126:                       true -> id(Left)
  127:                   end
  128:              of
  129:                  false ->
  130:                      false;
  131:                  true ->
  132:                      id(Right)
  133:              end,
  134:     {id({Left,Right,Simple}),Simple}.
  135: 
  136: unsafe_move_elimination_2(Int) ->
  137:     %% The type optimization pass would recognize that TagInt can only be
  138:     %% [0 .. 7], so the first 'case' would select_val over [0 .. 6] and swap
  139:     %% out the fail label with the block for 7.
  140:     %%
  141:     %% A later optimization would merge this block with 'expects_h' in the
  142:     %% second case, as the latter is only reachable from the former.
  143:     %%
  144:     %% ... but this broke down when the move elimination optimization didn't
  145:     %% take the fail label of the first select_val into account. This caused it
  146:     %% to believe that the only way to reach 'expects_h' was through the second
  147:     %% case when 'Tag' =:= 'h', which made it remove the move instruction
  148:     %% added in the first case, passing garbage to expects_h/2.
  149:     TagInt = Int band 2#111,
  150:     Tag = case TagInt of
  151:               0 -> a;
  152:               1 -> b;
  153:               2 -> c;
  154:               3 -> d;
  155:               4 -> e;
  156:               5 -> f;
  157:               6 -> g;
  158:               7 -> h
  159:           end,
  160:     case Tag of
  161:         g -> expects_g(TagInt, Tag);
  162:         h -> expects_h(TagInt, Tag);
  163:         _ -> Tag = id(Tag), ok
  164:     end.
  165: 
  166: expects_g(6, Atom) ->
  167:     Atom = id(g),
  168:     ok.
  169: 
  170: expects_h(7, Atom) ->
  171:     Atom = id(h),
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: %% When compiled with +no_copt, beam_validator would complain about
  175: %% ambiguous try/catch state.
  176: ambiguous_catch_try_state_1(<<42:false>>) ->
  177:     %% The beam_ssa_bsm pass will duplicate the entire second clause.
  178:     %% beam_jump will share the blocks with the build_stacktrace
  179:     %% instructions.
  180:     [];
  181: ambiguous_catch_try_state_1(V0) ->
  182:     try
  183:         try
  184:             receive after bad -> timeout end
  185:         catch
  186:             _:V0 ->
  187:                 error
  188:         after
  189:             ok
  190:         end
  191:     of
  192:         true ->
  193:             ok
  194:     catch
  195:         month:power:V2 ->
  196:             %% A build_stacktrace instruction would be shared, causing
  197:             %% an ambiguous try/catch state.
  198:             V2
  199:     after
  200:         a = b
  201:     end.
  202: 
  203: ambiguous_catch_try_state_2() ->
  204:     case
  205:         try
  206:             case false = 0 of
  207:                    false ->
  208:                        hand
  209:                end
  210:         catch
  211:             idea:[]:V1 ->
  212:                 V1;
  213:             country:42 ->
  214:                 %% if_end would be shared in an unsafe way.
  215:                 if 0 -> way end after [] end of [] -> if $X -> "D" end
  216:     end.
  217: 
  218: ambiguous_catch_try_state_3() ->
  219:     case
  220:         try
  221:             case false = 0 of
  222:                    false ->
  223:                        hand
  224:                end
  225:         catch
  226:             idea:[]:V1 ->
  227:                 V1;
  228:             country:42 ->
  229:                 %% case_end would be shared in an unsafe way.
  230:                 case x of y -> way end after [] end of [] -> case x of $X -> "D" end
  231:     end.
  232: 
  233: 
  234: ambiguous_catch_try_state_4() ->
  235:     0.0 = try binary_to_float(garbage_collect() orelse ((1.0 = tuple_to_list(ok)) -- ok))
  236:           after
  237:               ok
  238:           end.
  239: 
  240: -record(message2, {id, p1}).
  241: -record(message3, {id, p1, p2}).
  242: 
  243: build_tuple(_Config) ->
  244:     Message2 = #message2{},
  245:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Message2},_}} = (catch do_build_tuple(#message2{})),
  246:     ok.
  247: 
  248: do_build_tuple(Message) ->
  249:     if is_record(Message, message2) ->
  250: 	    Res = {res, rand:uniform(100)},
  251: 	    {Message#message3.id, Res}
  252:     end.
  253: 
  254: coverage(_Config) ->
  255:     ok = coverage_1(ok),
  256:     {error,badarg} = coverage_1({error,badarg}),
  257: 
  258:     gt = coverage_2(100, 42),
  259:     le = coverage_2(100, 999),
  260:     le = coverage_2([], []),
  261:     gt = coverage_2([], xxx),
  262: 
  263:     error = coverage_3(#{key => <<"child">>}),
  264:     error = coverage_3(#{}),
  265: 
  266:     ok = coverage_4(whatever),
  267:     -0.5 = coverage_4(any),
  268: 
  269:     ok.
  270: 
  271: coverage_1(Var) ->
  272:     case id(Var) of
  273: 	ok -> ok;
  274: 	Error -> Error
  275:     end.
  276: 
  277: %% Cover beam_jump:invert_test(is_ne_exact).
  278: coverage_2(Pre1, Pre2) ->
  279:     case
  280:         case Pre1 == [] of
  281:             false ->
  282:                 false;
  283:             true ->
  284:                 Pre2 /= []
  285:         end
  286:     of
  287:         true ->
  288:             gt;
  289:         false ->
  290:             case Pre1 > Pre2 of
  291:                 true ->
  292:                     gt;
  293:                 false ->
  294:                     le
  295:             end
  296:     end.
  297: 
  298: coverage_3(#{key := <<child>>}) when false ->
  299:     ok;
  300: coverage_3(#{}) ->
  301:     error.
  302: 
  303: %% Cover beam_jump:value_to_literal/1.
  304: coverage_4(whatever) ->
  305:     maybe
  306:         coverage_4(ok),
  307:         ok
  308:     end;
  309: coverage_4(_) ->
  310:     (bnot 0) / 2.
  311: 
  312: %% ERIERL-478: The validator failed to validate argument types when calls were
  313: %% shared and the types at the common block turned out wider than the join of
  314: %% each individual call site.
  315: call_sharing(_Config) ->
  316:     A_2 = {a, 1},
  317:     A_3 = {a, 1, 2},
  318: 
  319:     A_2 = cs_1(id(A_2)),
  320:     A_3 = cs_1(id(A_3)),
  321: 
  322:     B_2 = {b, 1},
  323:     B_3 = {b, 1, 2},
  324:     B_2 = cs_1(id(B_2)),
  325:     B_3 = cs_1(id(B_3)),
  326: 
  327:     C_2 = {c, 1},
  328:     C_3 = {c, 1, 2},
  329:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch (cs_1(id(C_2)))),
  330:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch (cs_1(id(C_3)))),
  331: 
  332:     ok.
  333: 
  334: cs_1(Key) ->
  335:     A = case Key of
  336:             %% Must be a single line to trigger the bug.
  337:             {Tag, _, _} when Tag == a; Tag == b -> cs_2(Key); {Tag, _} when Tag == a; Tag == b -> cs_2(Key)
  338:         end,
  339:     id(A).
  340: 
  341: cs_2(I) -> I.
  342: 
  343: undecided_allocation(_Config) ->
  344:     ok = catch undecided_allocation_1(<<10:(3*7)>>),
  345:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,<<0>>},_}} = catch undecided_allocation_1(8),
  346: 
  347:     {bar,1} = undecided_allocation_2(id(<<"bar">>)),
  348:     {foo,2} = undecided_allocation_2(id(<<"foo">>)),
  349:     {'EXIT',_} = catch undecided_allocation_2(id(<<"foobar">>)),
  350:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,error},_}} = catch undecided_allocation_2(id("foo,bar")),
  351:     {'EXIT',_} = catch undecided_allocation_2(id(foobar)),
  352:     {'EXIT',_} = catch undecided_allocation_2(id(make_ref())),
  353: 
  354:     ok = undecided_allocation_3(id(<<0>>), gurka),
  355:     {'EXIT', {badarith, _}} = catch undecided_allocation_3(id(<<>>), gurka),
  356: 
  357:     ok.
  358: 
  359: -record(rec, {}).
  360: undecided_allocation_1(<<10:3/integer-unit:7>>) ->
  361:     ok;
  362: undecided_allocation_1(V) ->
  363:     %% The record update operation would be duplicated by the beam_ssa_bssm
  364:     %% pass, and beam_jump would incorrectly share the resulting calls to
  365:     %% error/1, causing beam_validator to issue the following diagnostic
  366:     %% when this module was compiled with the no_type_opt option:
  367:     %%
  368:     %%  Internal consistency check failed - please report this bug.
  369:     %%  Instruction: {call_ext,1,{extfunc,erlang,error,1}}
  370:     %%  Error:       {allocated,undecided}:
  371: 
  372:     <<
  373:       <<0>> || <<0:V>> <= <<0>>
  374:     >>#rec{},
  375:     if whatever -> [] end.
  376: 
  377: undecided_allocation_2(Order) ->
  378:     {_, _} =
  379:         case Order of
  380:             <<"bar">> ->
  381:                 {bar, 1};
  382:             <<"foo">> ->
  383:                 {foo, 2};
  384:             S ->
  385:                 case string:split("foo", "o") of
  386:                     [] ->
  387:                         ok;
  388:                     _ ->
  389:                         %% The beam_ssa_bsm pass will duplicate this code,
  390:                         %% and beam_jump would undo the duplication by sharing
  391:                         %% the code that calls lists:flatten/1. The problem was
  392:                         %% that the stack frames had different sizes for the
  393:                         %% two calls to lists:flatten/1. The diagnostic would be:
  394:                         %%
  395:                         %%  Internal consistency check failed - please report this bug.
  396:                         %%  Instruction: {call_ext,1,{extfunc,lists,flatten,1}}
  397:                         %%  Error:       {allocated,undecided}:
  398: 
  399:                         lists:flatten(
  400:                             case S of
  401:                                 Y when is_binary(Y) -> Y;
  402:                                 Y -> string:split(Y, ",")
  403:                             end
  404:                         )
  405:                 end,
  406:                 error
  407:         end.
  408: 
  409: %% GH-6571: bs_init_writable can only be shared when the stack frame size is
  410: %% known.
  411: undecided_allocation_3(<<_>>, _) ->
  412:     ok;
  413: undecided_allocation_3(X, _) ->
  414:     case 0 + get_keys() of
  415:         X ->
  416:             ok;
  417:         _ ->
  418:             (node() orelse garbage_collect()) =:=
  419:                 case <<0 || false>> of
  420:                     #{} ->
  421:                         ok
  422:                 end
  423:     end.
  424: 
  425: id(I) ->
  426:     I.
